name: GalenWilkerson.GitHub.io
tagline: Machine Learning and Complex Systems Projects and Education
body:
I enjoy understanding Machine Learning, Complex Systems, and Data Science methods and concepts, and communicating them with others, especially in a fun or creative way.

I also enjoy helping others with understanding or writing about scientific or research topics, including editing or proofreading.

### About me:  
I am an experienced researcher in Complex Systems and Machine Learning, both in academia and private industry.

## Machine Learning
Most recently, I'm more interested in Machine Learning methods and how they can be used to understand data.  I recently worked analyzing Handwriting data (acceleration and orientation of pen while writing) to automatically detect written characters using signal processing and machine learning.  [See my project here.](https://github.com/galenwilkerson/Handwriting-Recognition).

## Complex Systems and Big Data
However, I have also published in the area of Complex Systems of Human Mobility, researching the scaling of human trip-lengths in cities, and comparing our results using conventional data to those obtained using Big Data.  Our goals was to determine whether human mobility is "super-diffusive" within cities.  That is, do people take more long trips than we might normally expect?  This could have large implications for energy consumption and urban planning.  [See my project here.](https://github.com/galenwilkerson/Human-Mobility-Research)

Also see [Publications](https://github.com/galenwilkerson/Publications) for more information.


### Python Tutorial in your browser

Here is a link to my [my repository](https://github.com/galenwilkerson), 
including a [version of the Python Tutorial](https://github.com/galenwilkerson/Tutorials/tree/master/Jupyter---Python3-tutorial-notebooks),
converted to run Python 3 in a Jupyter Notebook, in your browser!

Go here and download Anaconda version 3.5: (pre-packaged python for easy installation):

* [https://www.continuum.io/downloads](https://www.continuum.io/downloads)  (link on the RIGHT for Python 3)

* start with
> jupyter-notebook 3_An_Informal_Introduction_to_Python_(3).ipynb

I hope this helps :)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
